news1.title: Anti-Ukrainian propaganda has replaced much anti-vaccine propaganda, although the sources are often the same and tend to work in the interests of the Kremlin - according to analysis by Fakehunter.
news1.description: With the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the content of fake news circulating on social media changed almost overnight.

news2.title: Russian disinformation focuses its attack on the Polish economy - current and forecast directions
news2.description: Raw materials, currency risk, debt and conflict in the EU - this is what the Russians are focusing on. The apparent weakness of the Polish economy in the Russian propaganda war is a main narrative line.

news3.title: Russia’s key disinformation narratives addressed to Poles - Fakehunter analysis
news3.description: In Russia’s ongoing disinformation war, one can already talk of a "dedicated product,” that is propaganda messages based on what appears to be comprehensive analysis - taking into account Polish realities of life, fragments from some of the country’s tragic history, and Polish society’s likes and resentments.

news4.title: Orlen caught in Moscow’s crosshairs
news4.description: The Polish fuel market is very sensitive to 'information war' activities, such as fake news, for several reasons, the main one being that it is part of the energy sector - a critical element of any economy.

news5.title: Fake news: rtęć w Odrze - biała księga
news5.description: Od wieczora 11 sierpnia, przez kilka dni kolportowano w polskich mediach nieprawdziwą informację o niezwykle wysokiej zawartości rtęci w wodach Odry, powodującej masowe śnięcie ryb.
